script.name: !lib.ship.plotroute
script.sourceplaintext:
* Plots the best route based on sector weights * adjusts the route to jump to the further possible gate * =============================== * a.destintion - The destination, could be a sector, any object, or a position * a.ignoreJump - Should ignore jumping? even if autojump is enabled * a.weights - The weights table for each sector (which to avoid/block) * a.alwaysJump - Should always jump, even if autojump not enabled * a.ignoreFuel - Ignore checking energy needed (always jump as far as possible) * a.flags - Jump flags to override some checks (ie device/energy checks) * ===============================
* Compute the best route based on race weigths * Any race set to avoid or block has a higher weight $dest = $a.destination do if is datatype[ $a.destination ] == DATATYPE_ARRAY $dest = $a.destination[3] $route = [THIS] ->compute best route: target=$dest, weights table=$a.weights, allow hyperspeed=[FALSE]
* No route? sector must be unreachable (IE behind a HSAP) skip if $route return null skip if size of array $route return null
$sectors = array alloc: size=0
$should.jump = [FALSE] $min.jump = 0
* Check if we can jump to the closest gate $has.jumpdrive = [THIS] -> get amount of ware Jumpdrive in cargo bay do if $a.flags & [JumpFlg.NoDeviceCheck] $has.jumpdrive = [TRUE] do if $a.flags & [JumpFlg.NoEnergyCheck] $a.ignoreFuel = [TRUE] do if [THIS] -> get amount of ware Advanced Jumpdrive in cargo bay $has.jumpdrive = [TRUE]
* if ignoring jump, we should always fly if not $a.ignoreJump * only do jump calculation if device is installed (or overridden by flags) if $has.jumpdrive * if always jumping, then ignore min distance and autojump settings if $a.alwaysJump $should.jump = [TRUE] else if [THIS] -> is autojump activated $should.jump = [TRUE] $min.jump = [THIS] -> get autojump minimum jumps end end end
if [OWNER] == Player $find.flags = [Find.JumpableGate] | [Find.JumpBeacons] | [Find.Known] $find.flags.near = [Find.JumpableGate] | [Find.JumpBeacons] | [Find.Nearest] | [Find.Known] else $find.flags = [Find.JumpableGate] | [Find.JumpBeacons] $find.flags.near = [Find.JumpableGate] | [Find.JumpBeacons] | [Find.Nearest] end
$got.energy = [THIS] -> get true amount of ware Energy Cells in cargo bay * If ignoring fuel, then set energy to maximum do if $a.ignoreFuel OR $a.flags & [JumpFlg.NoEnergyCheck] $got.energy = 2147483647 do if [THIS] -> get amount of ware Advanced Jumpdrive in cargo bay $got.energy = 2147483647 do if [THIS] -> get amount of ware Jumpdrive Energy Generator in cargo bay $got.energy = 2147483647
$i = size of array $route dec $i = $previous = $route[$i] do if $previous == $dest $previous = $a.destination
* Now check the route backwards to find the furthest point we can jump to while $i dec $i = $dest = $route[$i]
do if $dest -> is of class Gate $dest = $dest -> get gate destination: return sector=[FALSE] $dest.sector = $dest -> get sector
$jumps = get jumps from sector [SECTOR] to sector $dest.sector if $should.jump AND $jumps >= $min.jump $needed.energy = [THIS] ->get needed jump energy: jumps=$jumps if $got.energy >= $needed.energy OR $a.ignoreFuel if is datatype[ $previous ] == DATATYPE_ARRAY $gate = find gate: flags=$find.flags.near, refobj=null, max dist=null, refpos=$previous object check=[THIS] else if $previous -> is of class Sector $gate = find gate: flags=$find.flags, refobj=$previous, max dist=null, refpos=null object check=[THIS] else if $previous -> exists $pos.array = $previous -> get position as array $prev.sector = $previous -> get sector append $prev.sector to array $pos.array $gate = find gate: flags=$find.flags.near, refobj=null, max dist=null, refpos=$pos.array object check=[THIS] else $gate = find gate: flags=$find.flags, refobj=$dest.sector, max dist=null, refpos=null object check=[THIS] end
if $gate -> exists append $gate to array $sectors break end end end
$previous = $route[$i] append $previous to array $sectors end
$sectors = reverse array $sectors return $sectors

comment.var: Plots the best route based on sector weights
adjusts the route to jump to the further possible gate
a.destintion - The destination, could be a sector, any object, or a position
a.ignoreJump - Should ignore jumping? even if autojump is enabled
a.weights - The weights table for each sector (which to avoid/block)
a.alwaysJump - Should always jump, even if autojump not enabled
a.ignoreFuel - Ignore checking energy needed (always jump as far as possible)
a.flags - Jump flags to override some checks (ie device/energy checks)
Compute the best route based on race weigths
Any race set to avoid or block has a higher weight
No route? sector must be unreachable (IE behind a HSAP)
Check if we can jump to the closest gate
if ignoring jump, we should always fly
only do jump calculation if device is installed (or overridden by flags)
if always jumping, then ignore min distance and autojump settings
If ignoring fuel, then set energy to maximum
Now check the route backwards to find the furthest point we can jump to

Ignore Jumping
Weights Table

Ignore Fuel
Jump Flags

a.weights - The weights table for each sector (which to avoid/block)

Check if we can jump to the closest gate
if ignoring jump, we should always fly

if always jumping, then ignore min distance and autojump settings
If ignoring fuel, then set energy to maximum
Now check the route backwards to find the furthest point we can jump to
